# Crown Heights Mutual Aid — Weekly Update

## This Week's Distributions

**Grocery Distribution**
Saturday, April 5 | 11 AM - 2 PM (or until supplies run out)
Brooklyn Public Library — Crown Heights Branch, 560 New York Ave

Fresh produce boxes from Farm to People, pantry bags, and diapers/wipes while supplies last. No signup needed, just show up.

**Hot Meal Service**
Every Sunday | 1 - 3 PM
St. Mark's Church, 1417 Union St at Brooklyn Ave

Home-cooked meals prepared by volunteers. This week: jerk chicken, rice and peas, salad. Vegetarian options available. Everyone welcome, no questions asked.

## Urgent Needs

We are running critically low on:
- Cooking oil (vegetable or canola, large bottles)
- Rice (any variety, large bags preferred)
- Menstrual products
- Size 4 and 5 diapers
- Winter coats (adult M/L/XL)

Drop off donations at 560 New York Ave during distribution hours or at the St. Mark's meal service.

Our fridge at Nostrand & St. Johns is restocked daily. Take what you need, leave what you can. The fridge at Franklin & Sterling has a broken compressor — we're working on it. ETA for repair: next week.
